result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DCPS Violation Report and Court's response: no change but monitor
ADA Colleen Lennon appeared for the State. Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner appeared in person with Defn. Plea hearing scheduled.
Plea hearing on November 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

2:03 PM Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner in court for Abram J Zwaska who appeared in court.  Attorney Timothy Verhoff in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
02:00 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Atty Nicholas Frederick Ganser by defn

Adjustment Number: 22A 021656,
Payable Number: 563398,
Receipt Number: 22RS020997,
Amount: $20.00
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Connor Stillwell.
 - Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol.
  Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

01:35 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Nicholas Frederick Gansner.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
